question: Government Account” means the account relating to the ______
answer: The Consolidated Fund, the Contingency Fund and the Public Account

question: Head of Office means (a) a Gazetted Officer declared as such in the _____
answer: Delegation of Financial Powers Rules

question: Appropriation means the _________(allocation/allotment/assignment), to meet specified expenditure, of funds included in a primary unit of appropriation
answer: Assignment

question: Administrator means______(HoD/Secretary/President/Administrator of a Union Territory)
answer: Administrator of a Union Territory

question: The model under which the buyer to straightway purchase goods followed by procurement of consumables, arranging comprehensive maintenance contact after warranty period and finally disposing the product after useful life
answer: Capex Model

question: The model under which the Seller provides the goods, maintains it and also provides the consumables as required and finally takes back the goods after useful/contracted life.  The expenditure is made by the Buyer in a staggered manner
answer: Opex Model

question: Accounts showing under the respective heads the annual receipts and disbursements for the purpose of Union, of each State and of each Union Territory having a Legislative Assembly (including Appropriation Accounts) are to be prepared every year by______
answer: The authorities authorised to maintain the accounts

question: The Annual Accounts of the Union are certified by the CAG whereas certification of the Annual Accounts of the States and UTs are done_____
answer: CAG

question: When the subject of a case concerns more than one Department, no order shall be issued until all such Departments have concurred, or, failing such concurrence, a decision has been taken by or under the authority of the _______
answer: Cabinet.

question: All Departmental regulations, in so far as they embody orders or instructions of a financial character or have important financial bearing, must invariably be made by, or with the approval of the ______
answer: Ministry of Finance

question: The systems and procedures established by GFRs may be modified by any other authority only with the express approval of the ______
answer: Ministry of Finance.

question: Primary unit of appropriation has been referred to in _______
answer: the Delegation of Financial Power (Rule 8)

question: A Department/Ministry of the Central Government is not a subordinate authority-True/False
answer: False. Department/Ministry or any officer sub-ordinate to President is a sub-ordinate authority.

question: Where amounts due to Government appear to be irrecoverable, their adjustment shall be made by____
answer: By obtaining the orders of the competent authority.

question: An Administrator or a Head of a Department responsible for the collection of revenue shall keep the __________ fully informed of the progress of collection of revenue under his control and of all important variations in such collections as compared with the ______
answer: Finance Ministry, Budget Estimates

question: When the maintenance of any rentable building is entrusted to a civil department, other than the CPWD, _________ shall be responsible for the due recovery of the rent thereof
answer: the Administrator or the Head of the Department concerned

question: The detailed rules and procedure, regarding the demand and recovery of rent of Government buildings and lands, are contained in the ________
answer: departmental regulations of the departments in charge of those building

question: The transaction pertaining to Public Accounts and its custody is referred to in Article____

All moneys received by or deposited with any officer employed in connection with the affairs of the Union in his capacity as such, other than revenues or public moneys raised or received by Government, shall be paid into ____
answer: The Public Account

question: All moneys received by or deposited with the Supreme Court of India or with any other Court, other than a High Court, within a Union Territory, shall be paid into___
answer: The Public Account. In case of High Court, it will be paid into Public Account of concerned State.

question: Form GAR 6 pertains to____
answer: Receipt of Government due.

question: The procedure for the assessment and recovery of rent of any building hired out will be regulated generally by the rules applicable to buildings under the direct charge of the _____
answer: Central Public Works Department

question: Each Accounts Officer will send an extract from his accounts showing the amounts brought to credit in the accounts _____ to the ______
answer: Monthly, Controlling Officer concerned

question: Standards of Financial Propriety has been mentioned in Rule___ of GFR 2017
answer: Rule 21

question: The financial powers of the Government, which have not been delegated to a subordinate authority, shall vest in the ______
answer: Finance Ministry

question: All draft memoranda for Expenditure Finance Committee or Public Investment Bureau or Committee on Establishment Expenditure and Cabinet Committee for Economic Affairs or Cabinet shall be circulated by the Ministry or Department concerned after consultation with the _____
answer: concerned Financial Adviser of the of the Ministry/Department

question: Statements showing the remissions of revenue and abandonment of claims to revenue sanctioned during the preceding year by competent authorities in exercise of the discretionary powers vested in them shall be submitted ____ by the Government Departments of the Central Government, Administrators and Heads of Departments to _____
answer: Annually (1st June), Audit and Accounts Officer concerned.

question: Individual remissions below Rupees _____ need not be included in the statements
answer: Rupees one thousand (1000)

question: Which department is exempted to submit Statements to its Audit and Accounts Officer showing the remissions of revenue and abandonment of claims to revenue sanctioned during the preceding year by competent authorities?
answer: Department of Post.

question: ________may make rules defining remissions and abandonments of revenue.
answer: Departments of the Central Government and Administrators

question: Which rule of GFR 2017 deals with Responsibility of Controlling Officer in respect of Budget allocation?
answer: Rule 26

question: The duties and responsibilities of a controlling officer in respect of funds placed at his disposal are to ensure four points____
answer: (i) that the expenditure does not exceed the budget allocation. ; (ii) that the expenditure is incurred for the purpose for which funds have been provided. ; (iii) that the expenditure is incurred in public interest. ; (iv) that adequate control mechanism is functioning in his Department for prevention, detection of errors and irregularities in the financial proceedings of his subordinate offices and to guard against waste and loss of public money

question: A subordinate authority shall not, without the previous consent of the ______ issue an order which involves any grant of land, or assignment of revenue, or concession, grant, lease or licence of mineral or forest rights, or rights to water, power or any easement or privilege of such concessions, or  involves relinquishment of revenue in any way
answer: Finance Ministry

question: All financial sanctions and orders issued by a competent authority shall be communicated to the ___.
answer: Audit Officer and the Accounts Officer

question: Copies of all General Financial Orders issued by a Department of the Central Government with the concurrence of the CAG shall be supplied to_____
answer: the CAG

question: Sanctions of contingent expenditure incurred under the powers of Head of Offices shall be communicated to Audit and Accounts Officer-True/False
answer: False. Other sanctions which need not be communicated to the Audit and Accounts Officer; (a) Sanctions relating to grant to advances to Central Government employees. ; (b) Sanctions relating to appointment or promotion or transfer of Gazetted and non-Gazetted Officers. ; (c) All sanctions relating to creation or continuation or abolition of posts. ; (d) Sanctions for handing over charge and taking over charge, etc. ; (e) Sanctions relating to payment or withdrawal of General Provident Fund advances to Government servants.; (f) Other sanctions of routine nature issued by Heads of Subordinate Officers (other than those issued by Ministries or Departments proper and under powers of a Head of Department)

question: A sanction for any fresh charge shall, unless it is specifically renewed, lapse if no payment in whole or in part has been made during a period of _______ from the date of issue of such sanction.
answer: twelve (12) months with certain exceptions.

question: When there is a specific provision in a sanction that the expenditure would be met from the Budget provision of a specified financial year, it shall lapse_____
answer: at the close of that financial year

question: A sanction will not lapse within the period of one year of the date of issue of that sanction, even if the actual payment in whole or in part has not been made during the said period in case of______
answer: purchase of stores if tenders have been accepted (in the case of local or direct purchase of stores) or the indent has been placed (in the case of Central Purchases) on the Central Purchase Organization within one of date of such sanction

question: A sanction in respect of an addition to a permanent establishment, made from year to year under a general scheme by a competent authority, or in respect of an allowance sanctioned for a post or for a class of Government servants, but not drawn by the officer(s) concerned, shall lapse after___
answer: Shall not lapse.

question: Provision for remission of disallowances by Audit and writing off of overpayments made to Government servants has been made in____
answer: Delegation of Financial Power Rules, 1978

question: Any loss or shortage of public moneys, stores or other public property shall be immediately reported by the subordinate authority concerned to the three authorities______
answer: (i) next higher authority (ii) the Statutory Audit Officer and (iii) to the concerned Principal Accounts Officer (with certain exception)

question: Petty losses of value _____need not be reported to concerned authorities.
answer: not exceeding Rupees ten thousand (Rs.10000)

question: Cases involving serious irregularities shall be brought to the notice of ______
answer: Financial Adviser or Chief Accounting Authority i.e. Secretary of the Ministry or Department concerned and the Controller General of Accounts, Ministry of Finance.

question: Report of loss shall be made at _____
answer: two stages (i) An initial report and (ii) The final report

question: The loss should be disposed of by the Head of Department in accordance with the power delegated under Delegation of Financial Power Rules, 1978. However, the reports, which he cannot finally dispose of under the delegated powers, shall be submitted to_____
answer: the Finance Ministry.

question: An amount lost through misappropriations, defalcation, embezzlement, etc., may be redrawn on____
answer: a simple receipt

question: Who will bear the loss to Government on account of culpability of Government servants?
answer: Central or State Government concerned.

question: All cases involving loss of Government money arising from erroneous or irregular issue of cheques or irregular accounting of receipts will be reported to the ______
answer: The CGA

question: All losses of government property due to suspected fire, theft, fraud etc. shall be invariably reported to the Police provided the loss amounting to ______
answer: above the value of Rupees Fifty thousand (Rs. 50000)

question: All loss of immovable property ______caused by fire, flood, cyclone, earthquake or any other natural cause, shall be reported at once by the subordinate authority concerned to Government through the usual channel.
answer: exceeding Rupees fifty thousand (Rs. 50000)

question: A copy of the _______of loss or an abstract thereof should be forwarded to the Audit officer and Pay and Accounts Officer.
answer: Detailed report (at the time of submission of detailed report to the Govt.)

question: Which rule (s) of GFR 2017 deal with submission of records and information to Audit?
answer: Rule 39 to 41.

question: If the contents of any file are categorized as ‘Secret’ or ‘Top Secret’ the file maybe sent personally to the Head of the Audit Office-True/False
answer: TRUE

question: Which Article of the Constitutions deals with the Budget or Annual Financial Statement?
answer: Article 112 to 116; (i) Article 112 (1) Presentation to Houses of Parliament; (ii) Article 113: Procedure of budget ; (iii) Article 114: Appropriation bill; (iv) Article 115: Supplementary, Additional, Excess Grant, ; (v) Article 116: Vote on Accounts, Vote on Credit, Exceptional Grant and Token Grant;

question: Who shall cause to lay the budget before the Houses of Parliament?
answer: The President. Finance Minister just makes arrangement to lay the same

question: With the merger of Railway Budget with the General Budget, the Demands for Grants and the Statement of Budget Estimates of Railways shall also be part of the General Budget from year___
The authority estimating receipt shall give the break-up of the Major Head, Minor/Subhead/ Detailed wise estimate along with actuals of the past ______
answer: three years

question: The accounting heads under which major tax and non-tax revenues are collected shall be prescribed by _____ in consultation with the _______
answer: the administrative Ministry, Budget Division in the Finance Ministry

question: Tax revenues, non-debt capital receipts including disinvestments and borrowings are managed by______
answer: Various departments under Ministry of Finance. Non-tax revenue are managed by other Ministries/Departments/Autonomous bodies.

question: User charges is a ______types of revenue.
answer: Non-tax

question: Rates of user charges should be linked with appropriate price indices and reviewed at least every ___
answer: three years.

question: User charges is fixed through____(executive orders/statue)
answer: Executive Order or Rules so that it can easily be revised.

question: Settlement of payments against supplies arranged by the Directorate General of Supplies and Disposals (DGS&D) in the Department of Supply; in the Ministry of Commerce on behalf of Railway, Defence and Posts is done through_____
answer: Central Accounts Section, RBI (Nagpur). Other transactions which are settled through Central Accounts Section; (i) Dividend payable in lieu of tax on Railway Passenger Fares, by Railways to Central Revenues.; (ii) Loans from General Revenues to Railways and recovery of interest on loans and advances to Railways.; (iii) Settlement of Income Tax recoveries made from staff salary bills of Railways.; (iv) Settlement of transactions pertaining to Centre and other states against the balance of a state.; (v) Transactions of the Central and State Government handled in other countries by the Indian Embassies/Missions

question: Dividends and profits including the transfer of surplus from Reserve Bank of India are part of ____revenue
answer: Non-tax

question: Article ______deals with charged expenditure whereas voted expenditures are dealt in Article ___
The detailed estimates of expenditure shall be prepared by which head of accounts? (Major/minor etc)
answer: Object Head. It is the primary unit of appropriation of fund.

question: Only one Demand for Grant is presented in respect of each Ministry or Department no matter how large is a Ministry or Department-True/False
answer: False. It is generally but for large ministries/departments more than one demand for grant may be presented.

question: The Demand for Grants shall be presented to Parliament at _____ levels.
answer: Two levels (Main Demand & Detailed Demand)

question: Departmentally Related Standing Committee” (DRSC) of the Parliament considers ____demand presented to Parliament by______.
answer: Detailed demand for grant, concerned Ministries/ Departments. Main demand for grant is presented by Ministry of Finance (Budget Division) along with Budget

question: The forms for Annual Financial Statement (Budget) and Demand for Grant are prescribed by____
answer: Ministry of Finance.

question: Who prepares Outcome budget Statement?
answer: Department of Expenditure in consultation with NITI Aayog and concerned ministries/departments

question: The Budget statement where outlays are linked against each scheme/project with the outputs/deliverables and medium term outcomes in measurable/quantitative terms is called_____
answer: Outcome Budget.

question: To cover expenditure for a brief period pending the completion of the budget procedure under Article 113, the permission given by the Parliament is called_____
answer: Vote on Account. Generally 1/6th of the budget provision (Article 116)

question: The control of expenditure against the budget shall be exercised through____
answer: the Heads of Departments and other Controlling Officers, if any, and Disbursing Officers subordinate to them.

question: All the DDOs will send a copy of the entries made in GFR 5 during the preceding month to ____ within_____
answer: the Head of the Department or other designated Controlling Officer, .On the third day of each month. If there are no entries in the register in any month, a ‘nil’ statement shall be sent.

question: The controlling officer maintains records in ____ and ____ to monitor the monthly return from DDOs and their compilation.
answer: GFR 6 and GFR 7.

question: Who shall be responsible for the monthly reconciliation of the figures given in the accounts maintained by the Head of the Department with those appearing in the Accounts Officer’s books?
answer: The Head of the Department and the Accounts Officer jointly

question: The Head of the Department shall furnish a quarterly certificate to the Principal Accounts Officer certifying the correctness of the figures for the quarter by the ______
answer: 15th of the second following month after the quarter in question.

question: The Departments of the Central Government shall obtain from their Heads of Departments and other offices under them the departmental figures of expenditure in Form _____ by the _____
answer: GFR 8, 15th of the following month

question: Appropriation accounts are prepared on the basis of the figures booked in the ______
answer: Records of Accounts office. In case there is differences in the figure in department record and those appearing in the record of Accounts Officer, the figure of accounts officer shall be assumed to be correct.

question: A Controlling Officer shall obtain from the spending authorities liability statements in Form ___ every month starting from the month of ______.
answer: GFR 3A, October in each financial year. Controlling Officer maintains Liability Register in GFR 3.

question: The Accounts Officer shall report to _____ immediately on the first appearance of any disproportionate expenditure.
answer: The Head of the Department concerned. The authority administering a grant /appropriation is ultimately responsible for the control of expenditure against the grant/appropriation and not the Accounts Officer.

question: The Accounts Officer shall not allow any payment against sanctions in excess of the Budget provisions unless there is specific approval of the _______
answer: Chief Accounting Authority.

question: Who should ensure availability of funds through Re-appropriation/ Supplementary Grant before according concurrence for excess under any Head?
answer: The Financial Advisers and Chief Accounting Authority

question: The funds provided during the financial year and not utilized before the close of that financial year shall stand lapsed at the _______
answer: close of the financial year.

question: ________ shall ensure adherence to the stipulated Quarterly Expenditure Plan and the guidelines issued in this regard by Ministry of Finance from time to time.
answer: The Financial Advisers of the Ministries/Departments

question: Where any excess over the allotment is apprehended, the subordinate authority shall obtain additional allotment _____.
answer: before incurring the excess expenditure

question: Re-appropriation of fund means transfer of fund from______ unit to _____.
answer: Primary, another primary unit. It has been provisioned in Rule 10 of DFPR, 1978.

question: In all orders, sanctioning re-appropriation, the reasons for saving and excess of ____ shall be invariably stated.
answer: ₹ 1 lakh or over. A copy of such order/sanction shall be endorsed to the Accounts Officer.

question: The procedure for obtaining an advance from the Contingency Fund and recoupment of the Fund have been given in _____
answer: The Contingency Fund of India Rules, 1952.

question: _____ is responsible and accountable for financial management of his Ministry or Department.
answer: Chief Accounting Authority i.e. Secretary

question: The main principles according to which the accounts of the Government of India shall be maintained are contained in _______
answer: (i) GAR, 1990 (ii) Accounting Rules for Treasuries and (iii) Account Code Volume-III

question: Government accounts are maintained on _______basis of accounting.
answer: Cash. Other mode of accounting may be made on the order of the Central Govt. on the advice of the CAG.

question: Conditions for not re-appropriating fund from a given unit are__
answer: Two (i) when it is known or anticipated that the appropriation for the unit from which funds are to be transferred shall not be utilized in full or that savings can be effected in the appropriation for the said unit.(ii) with the intention of restoring the diverted appropriation to that unit when savings become available under other units later in the year.

question: When a need arises to incur unforeseen expenditure in excess of the sanctioned grant or appropriation or on a new service not provided in Budget and there is not sufficient time for the voting of the Supplementary Demand and the passing of the connected appropriation bill before close of the financial year, it should be_____
answer: met from an advance from Contingency Fund.

question: ___appears before the Committee on Public Accounts and any other Parliamentary Committee for examination on behalf a Ministry/Department.
answer: The Secretary.

question: Consolidated Fund, Contingency Fund and Public Account of UT are established under______
answer: Section 47 and 48 of UT Act, 1963 for Consolidated Fund & Contingency Fund respectively. UTs do not have a separate Public Account of their own. Such transaction are recorded under Public Accounts of India. Hence, it is established under Article 266 (2) of Constitution.

question: ______ may open Sub-Heads and Detailed Heads as required by them in consultation with the___
answer: Ministries/Departments, Budget Division of the Ministry of Finance.

question: The object heads have been prescribed in______
answer: DFPR, 1978 (Rule 8).

question: _____ shall have assignment accounts with the identified branches of the Accredited Bank of the Ministry.
answer: Pay & Accounts offices and Cheque Drawing and Disbursing Officer

question: The word PFMS stands for____
answer: Public Financial Management System

question: DBT should include cash transfers to beneficiaries as well as transfers/honorariums given to various enablers of government schemes like community workers, etc. for successful implementation of the schemes and not in-kind transfer-True/False
answer: False. It includes both cash and in-kind transfers.

question: Transaction charges for the financial intermediaries facilitating DBT payments shall be paid as stipulated by____
answer: Ministry of Finance.

question: _______may open Sub/Detailed Heads required under the Minor Heads falling within the _____in consultation with Budget Division of the Ministry of Finance
answer: Principal Accounts Offices, Public Account of India

question: Who can amend or modify an existing object head and open a new object head?
answer: Department of Expenditure/CGA (MoF) on the advice of the CAG

question: The word ICT used in Direct Benefit Transfer programme & scheme stands for_____
answer: Information and Communication Technology.

question: Proforma accounts relating to Public Works shall be prepared by _____
answer: the Accounts Officers in accordance with the instructions contained in Account Code for Accountants General. In case of other department, it is departmental authorities who prepares proforma accounts in accordance with their respective departmental regulations.

question: Who will act as a Designated Officer with respect to a Personal Deposit Accounts?
answer: Government officers acting in their official or any other capacity

question: The Personal Deposit Account shall be authorised to be opened by the _____in consultation with ______
answer: Ministry or Department concerned, the CGA

question: Expenditure on a temporary asset cannot ordinarily be considered as a capital expenditure and shall not be debited to a Capital Head except in cases specifically authorised by the ______on_____
answer: The President, the CAG

question: Where loans outstanding against Public Sector Undertakings may be converted into equity investments in or as grants-in-aid to the Public Sector Undertakings, approval by ______is needed.
answer: the Parliament (by including a token provision in the relevant Demands for Grants or Supplementary Demands for Grants)

question: For capital outlay met out of specific loans raised by Government, the interest shall be charged at such rate as may be prescribed by_____
answer: Government (the rate of interest actually paid on such loans and the incidental charges incurred in raising and managing them). In other cases other than specific loan, it is determined by Department of Economic Affair (MoF) each year.

question: The interest shall be calculated on the direct capital outlay at the end of the previous year plus half the outlay of the year itself, irrespective of whether such outlay has been met from current revenues or from other sources-True/False
answer: True.

question: When under any special orders of Government, charges for interest during the process of construction of a project are temporarily met from capital, the writing back of capitalised interest shall form the ______
answer: first charge on any capital receipts or surplus revenue derived from the project when opened for working.

question: The period accepted mutually by Central and State Governments for re-audit of past transactions involving errors in classification is____
answer: Three years.

question: If a doubt arises as to whether a particular claim would fall within or outside the purview of the proposed reciprocal arrangement amongst different Governments, it shall be decided by ___
answer: mutual consultation. Such arrangement will remain in force without any time limit in respect of all State Governments.

question: In the case of joint Projects of Governments, recoveries of expenditure by the Government which incurred the expenditure at first instance from other participating Government shall be taken as_
answer: Abatement (reduction) of charges.

question: State Government prefers claim for execution of power and duties conferred or imposed on the State Government by Central Government under Article____
answer: 258 (3). Under 258 (1) the President may with the consent of the Governor of a State entrust executive power of the Union either conditionally or unconditionally. In case of disagreement under Article 258(3) Ministry of Finance shall be consulted.

question: Cost of additional staff employed or contingent and other expenditure, as in the case of work devolving on the State Governments in connection with the administration of the Census Act, is reimbursable under Article____
answer: 258 (3). Expenditure in this regard shall be provided in the State Budget in the first instance and adjusted in the accounts of the State Governments under the normal Heads of Accounts. These will be reimbursed in lump-sum to the State Governments,

question: If the claims of State Government under Article 258 (3) are found to be reasonable and do not exceed______ per annum for any individual item (or connected group of items), a ____ years’ contract shall be offered to the State Government during which the Central Government would pay the fixed sum per annum for the work.
answer: Rupees Fifty thousand (₹ 50000), Five (5) years. The contract will be reviewed every five year. If the amount agreed upon exceeds Rupees Fifty thousand, it shall be necessary to have an annual statement of proposed charges f r o from the State Government at the time of preparation of the Budget.

question: The expenditure connected with the construction or maintenance of National Highways etc. shall be borne by_____
answer: Central Government. State Government books the expenditure under the Major Head 8658-Suspense and got it reimbursed.

question: A State function may be entrusted to the Central Government under the provision of Article___
answer: 258A. In such case, the expenditure at first instance is reflected in the Budget of the Central Government and later debited to the State Government’s accounts.

question: RBI closes its yearly accounts on____
answer: 15th April. Inter-Governmental adjustments can be carried out up-to this date.

question: A charges relating to the maintenance and demarcations and disputes over boundaries between India and a foreign country shall be borne by____
answer: Central Govt. and foreign country concerned. Failure on the part to recover from foreign country, it will be borne by the Central Government.

question: Share of charges of which country on accounts of maintenance and demarcations and disputes over boundaries is borne by the Government of India?
answer: Bhutan

question: Central Purchase Organisation i.e. Director-General of Supplies and Disposals, New Delhi is a______ department.
answer: Service. Public Works, Forest, Government Printing, Department of Survey etc. are also types of service department.

question: All claims shall ordinarily be preferred between Departments be it commercial and non-commercial of the Central Government, within _____ and not beyond____.
answer: the same financial year, three years from the date of transaction. This limitation may be waived off in specific cases.

question: Provision for the settlement of inter-departmental adjustments has been made in___
answer: GAR, 1990 (Chapter 4).

question: Between different Departments of the same Government, the recoveries effected for services rendered shall be classified as______
answer: Reduction of expenditure in respect of service department. In case of commercial department, it is treated as receipt.

question: The Railways, Posts and Defence Departments are regarded as separate Governments for the purpose of adjustment of pensionary charges-True/False.
answer: True.

question: In the case of Government Departments and Undertakings declared as commercial, adjustment of Pensionary liability shall be made in the regular accounts by charging the _____ for ___ year of service based on the rates of monthly contribution of pension.
answer: average of the percentage, 15th

question: Special repairs to previously abandoned buildings or structures including remodelling or replacement is classified as_____ work.
answer: Original Work. It includes new constructions, site preparation, additions and alterations to existing works, special repairs to newly purchased

question: A Ministry or Department at its discretion may directly execute repair works estimated to cost ___
answer: up to Rupees Thirty (30) Lakhs. In case of repair works exceeding ₹ 30 lakh, the Ministry/Department may at discretion award such work to Public Works Organisation, Public Sector undertaking or other agencies notified by Ministry of Urban Development (MoUD).

question: Grants for Civil Works are administered by_______
answer: Central Public Works Department. Works not specifically allotted to any Ministry or Department shall be included in the Grants for Civil Works.

question: May a work be financed partly from funds provided in departmental budget and partly from the budget for Civil works? Yes/No
answer: No.

question: Limited tenders with respect to execution of work by a Ministry/Department under its own arrangement will be called for works costing _____
answer: less than Rupees five (5) lakhs. Open tender for works costing ₹5 lakh to 25 lakh.

question: The Public Works Organisation or the Public Sector Undertaking or any Organisation allotted work shall then execute the work entrusted to it in accordance with the rules and procedures prescribed in ____
answer: the organisation to which allotted. A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) may be drawn.

question: After a project costing_____ is approved the ______will set up a Review Committee to review the progress of the work.
answer: ₹ 100 crore or above, Administrative Ministry or Department. The Committee shall have the powers to accept variation within 10% of the approved estimates.

question: A Review Committee consists _____members.
answer: Three (3). One representative each from Administrative Ministry, Finance (Internal Finance Wing) and the Executing agency.

question: No Review Committee should be constituted for a work costing ₹ 100 crore-True/False
answer: False. It will be at the discretion of the Administrative Min/Dep concerned whether to set up a Review committee or not.

question: The Ministries or Departments have been delegated ______ (Full/limited/no) power to make their own arrangements for procurement of goods.
answer: full powers

question: All ________ shall prepare ______ Procurement Plan before the commencement of the year and the same should also be placed on their website.
answer: Ministries/Departments, Annual (within 30 days of the approval of the budget)

question: Term Rate contract is associated with ________
answer: DGS&D. The items of DGS&D are of common nature and required on recurring basis.

question: The term GeM stands for____
answer: Government e-Marketplace. The credential of suppliers on GeM are certified by the DGS&D.

question: Government may buy direct on-line through any of the available suppliers on GeM where purchases amounting ______
answer: Up-to 50000/-. 50000 to 30 lakh- lowest of at least 3 bidders on GeM, above 30 lakh- mandatorily obtaining bids, using online bidding or reverse auction tool provided on GeM.

question: The suppliers registered by DGS& D are prima facie eligible for consideration for procurement of goods through_____(tender type)
answer: Limited Tender Enquiry. They are also exempted from furnishing bid security. Such suppliers are registered for minimum one (1) year and maximum three (3) years after which it is renewed afresh

question: A bidder debarred for corruption or any law in force, he or any successor of the bidder shall not be eligible to participate in a procurement process of any procuring entity for a period ____
answer: not exceeding three years commencing from the date of debarment. On account of breach of integrity, a procuring entity may debar a bidder or its successor for a period not exceeding two years. Debarment shall be done only after bidder has been given due opportunity to represent his/her point.

question: The term ACASH stands for____
answer: Association of Corporations and Apex Societies of Handlooms. KVIC- Khadi Village Industries Commission, Micro, MSME- Small and Medium Enterprises, CPPP- Central Public Procurement Portal

question: Which rule of GFR 2017 deals with procurement of goods and service without inviting quotations?
answer: (i) Rule 154. Up-to ₹25000/-on the basis a certificate given by the competent authority. (ii) Rule 155-Purchase of goods by Purchase committee for value 25001-250000. It consists of three (3) members of appropriate level decided by the HoD. A joint certificate is render by the committee. (iii) Rule 158- Purchase of goods by obtaining bids.

question: Individual cases where confidentiality is required, for reasons of national security, would be exempted from the mandatory e-publishing requirement under the approval of_____ with the concurrence of____
answer: the Secretary of the Ministry/Department, the concerned Financial Advisor. In case of Autonomous and Statutory Body-Head of Body with the concurrence of Head of Finance

question: Information on the number of cases in which exemption was granted and the value of the concerned contract should be intimated on a ______ basis to _____
answer: Quarterly, Department of Expenditure (MoF)

question: It is mandatory for Ministries/Departments to receive all bids through e-procurement portals in respect of all procurements including procurements made by Ministries/Departments through DGS&D Rate Contracts-True/False
answer: False. Not applies to procurement through DGS&D and procurements concerning national security.

question: Procurement of goods is resorted through advertised tender enquiry when the estimated value of such procurement is___
answer: Rs 25 lakh and above (Rule 161). Limited Tender Enquiry for purchase below ₹ 25 lakh (Rule 162).

question: Ordinarily, the minimum time to be allowed for submission of bids should be ____ from the date of publication of the tender notice or availability of the bidding document for sale, whichever is later.
answer: Three (3) weeks. Four (4) weeks for all where the bid from abroad is also intended.

question: The number of supplier firms in Limited Tender Enquiry should be ___.
answer: more than three (3)

question: Technical Bid and Financial Bid are the part of______
answer: Two bid system. It is resorted for purchasing high value plant, machinery etc. of a complex and technical nature. (i) Technical bid consisting of all technical details along with commercial terms and conditions; (ii) Financial bid indicating item-wise price for the items mentioned in the technical bid.

question: Where a bidder invited to bid but not in a position to supply the subject matter of procurement due to modification in the specifications or terms and condition and withdraw from bidding proceeding, his bid security should _____
answer: not be forfeited. He should not be penalised in other way also.

question: In which case a Proprietary Article Certificate in the prescribed form is to be provided by the Ministry/Department before procuring the goods?
answer: Single Tender Enquiry other than procurement made from a single source in an emergency.

question: An online real-time purchasing technique utilised by the procuring entity to select the successful bid, which involves presentation by bidders of successively more favourable bids during a scheduled period of time and automatic evaluation of bids is called ______
answer: Electronic Reverse Auctioning.

question: A bidding documents consists of _____chapters.
answer: Seven. 1-Instruction to bidders, 2- Conditions of Contract,3- Schedule of Requirements, 4- Specifications and allied Technical Details, 5- Price Schedule (to be utilised by the bidders for quoting their prices), 6- Contract Form and 7- Other Standard Forms, if any, to be utilised by the purchaser and the bidders.

question: Amount of bid security should ordinarily range between ______ percent of the estimated value of the goods to be procured.
answer: two percent to five. Exemption from deposited bid security is given to Micro and Small Enterprises (MSEs) as defined in MSE Procurement Policy, suppliers registered with the Central Purchase Organisation and Ministry/Department concerned. In addition, Ministry/Department may require Bidders to sign a Bid securing declaration in place of bid security by virtue of which a bidder may be barred in case in fails to abide by the conditions.

question: The bid security should remain valid for a period of ______ beyond the final bid validity period.
answer: forty-five (45) days. It should be returned to unsuccessful bidders at the earliest after expiry of the final bid validity and latest on or before the 30th day after the award of the contract.

question: Performance Security should be for an amount of ______percent of the value of the contract
answer: five to ten. When it is received bid security is returned. It should remain valid for a period of sixty (60) days beyond the date of completion of all contractual obligations

question: Advance payment to supplier may be made _____ conditions.
answer: two. (i) Maintenance contracts for servicing of Air- conditioners, computers, other costly equipment, etc. and (ii) fabrication contracts, turn-key contracts etc.

question: The amount of advance payments should not exceed _____percent of contract value
answer: Private firms-30%, State or Central Government agency or a Public Sector Undertaking-40% and Maintenance contract- amount payable for six months under the contract. It may be relaxed by Min./Dep in consultation with Financial Advisor. Advance payment should be covered by obtaining a bank guarantee.

question: In cases where only one Bid is submitted the process may be considered invalid on account of lack of competition-True/False
answer: False. Lack of competition shall not be determined solely on the basis of the number of Bidders. There are other condition such as tender was adequately advertised and sufficient time was given for submission of bid, the qualification criteria were not unduly restrictive and c. prices are reasonable in comparison to market values

question: In case a purchase Committee is constituted to purchase or recommend the procurement, no member of the purchase Committee should be reporting directly to any other member of such Committee in case estimated value of procurement exceeds _______
answer: ₹ 25 lakhs.

question: Type of service that involves primarily non-physical project-specific, intellectual and procedural processes where outcomes/deliverables would vary from one consultant to another is called______
answer: Consultancy Service

question: Preparation of a long list of potential consultants may be done on the basis of formal or informal enquiries from other Ministries or Departments or Organisations involved in similar activities, Chambers of Commerce & Industry, Association of consultancy firms etc. where the estimated cost of the consulting service is _____
answer: up to Rupees twenty-five (25) lakhs. Where the estimated value exceeds ₹ 25 lakhs, in addition an enquiry for seeking ‘Expression of Interest from consultants should be published on Central Public Procurement Portal (CPPP)

question: The number of short listed consultants should be______
answer: not be less than three. Proposals should ordinarily be invited from consultants in ‘Two bid’ system with technical and financial bids sealed separately.

question: Technical bids in respect of procurement of consultancy services should be analysed and evaluated by______ constituted by ______.
answer: a Consultancy Evaluation Committee (CEC), the Ministry or Department concerned.

question: QCBS stands for_____
answer: Quality and Cost Based Selection. It is used in Procurement of consultancy services where quality is a prime concern. Under this quality of technical proposals is scored as per criteria announced in the RFP. Only those responsive proposals that have achieved at least minimum specified qualifying score in quality of technical proposal are considered further.

question: The weight age of the technical parameters i.e. non- financial parameters under Quality and Cost Based Selection system in no case should exceed ____%

Where well established methodologies, practices and standards exist. Unlike QCBS, there is no weight age for Technical score in the final evaluation and the responsive technically qualified proposal with the lowest evaluated cost shall be selected. The method is called______
answer: Least Cost System (LCS).

question: Identification of likely contractors for non-consulting services is prepared by the Ministry/Department from______
answer: formal or informal enquiries from other Ministries or Departments and Organisations involved in similar activities, scrutiny of ‘Yellow pages, trade journals, web site etc. From this list, the shortlisting of contractors shall made where the estimated cost of such service is up-to ₹ 10 lakh. The minimum shortlisted contractors should be more than three (3). The Ministry or Department should issue advertisement in such case should be given on Central Public Procurement Portal (CPPP), on GeM and on its website where the cost exceeds ₹ 10 lakh..

question: Calculation of the charges to be recovered from the local bodies, contractors and others on account of hiring out of Fixed Assets to them should be based on ______ cost.
answer: the historical.

question: A physical verification of all the consumable goods and materials should be undertaken at least once in _____
answer: a year

question: The inventory carrying cost is an expenditure that adds value to the material being stocked-True/False
answer: False. It does not add any value to material and therefore, a material remaining in stock for over a year shall generally be considered surplus, unless adequate reasons to treat it otherwise exist.

question: Physical verification of Library books in case of libraries having upto twenty thousand (20000) volumes shall be done____
answer: once every year (Complete physical verification) Where volumes range between 20001-50000 once in every three years (complete physical verification) and in case of volume of library books exceeds 50000, sample physical verification once in every three years. In case such verification reveals unusual or unreasonable shortages, complete verification shall be done.

question: Reasonable loss of library books means_____
answer: Loss of five volumes per one thousand volumes of books (0.5%) issued/consulted in a year other than dishonesty and negligence. However, loss of a book of a value exceeding Rs. 1,000/- (Rupees One thousand only) and rare books irrespective of value shall invariably be investigated

question: Scrap lots comprising of hazardous waste, batteries etc. shall be sold keeping in view the extant guidelines of ______
answer: Ministry of Environment & Forest.

question: The mode of disposal will be determined by the competent authority for surplus or obsolete or unserviceable goods with residual value ______
answer: less than Rupees Two Lakh (200000). Where the residual value exceeds ₹ 200000/-, the disposal of surplus/obsolete/unserviceable items shall be done by obtaining bids through advertised tender or public auction.

question: In respect of surplus or obsolete or unserviceable goods intended to be disposed of by advertised tender, the amount of bid security should ordinarily be ______ percentage.
answer: ten (10%) of the assessed or reserved price of the goods. In case of public auction, the bid security on acceptance of bid should not be less than 25% of bid value and collected on the spot. Balance before handing over the goods.

question: If a Ministry or Department is unable to sell any surplus or obsolete or unserviceable item in spite of its attempts through advertised tender or auction, it may dispose of the same at its scrap value with the approval of the competent authority in consultation with _____.
answer: its Finance division. If unable to sell the item even at its scrap value, it may adopt any other mode of disposal including destruction of the item in an eco-friendly manner.

question: Losses due to depreciation shall be analysed and recorded under ____ (two/three) heads
answer: Four (4). (I) normal fluctuation of market prices (ii) normal wear and tear (iii) lack of foresight in regulating purchases and (iv) negligence after purchase Not due to depreciation: (I) losses due to theft or fraud (ii) losses due to neglect (iii) anticipated losses on account of obsolescence of stores or of purchases in excess of requirements (iv) losses due to damage, and (v) losses due to extra ordinary situations under ‘Force Majeure’ conditions like fire, flood, enemy action, etc.

question: Which article of Indian Constitution deals with provision relating to contract?
answer: Article 299(1). General procedure prescribed with regard to various classes of contracts and assurances of property are laid down in of the Delegation of Financial Powers Rules (Rule 21).

question: The various classes of contracts and assurances of property, which may be executed by different authorities, are issued by the Ministry of _____.
answer: Law.

question: A Ministry or Department may, at its discretion, make purchases of value ______ by issuing purchase orders containing basic terms and conditions
answer: ₹ two lakh and fifty thousand (250000).

question: The letter of acceptance will be treated as a contract where tender documents include the General Conditions of Contract (GCC), Special Conditions of Contract (SCC) and scope of work in respect of Works Contracts, or Contracts for purchases valued _____
answer: between Rupees one lakh to Rupees ten lakhs (100000-1000000). Where the amount is ₹10 lakh & above (works) and above ₹ 10 lakh (purchase), a formal contract shall be executed.

question: Contract document should be executed in cases of ___ irrespective of amount involved.
answer: turn-key works or agreements for maintenance of equipment, provision of services etc.

question: Contract document wherever necessary should be executed within _____of the issue of letter of acceptance.
answer: 21 days

question: Price Variation Clause can be provided only in long-term contracts, where the delivery period extends beyond ____
answer: 18 months. No price variation will be admissible beyond the original Scheduled Delivery Date for defaults on the part of the supplier.

question: Copies of all contracts and agreements for purchases of the value of _____ should be sent to the Audit Officer and /or the Accounts officer as the case may be.
answer: ₹ 25 lakh and above. Copies of all rate and running contracts entered into by civil departments of the Government other CPO i.e. DGS&D should also be forwarded to Audit/Accounts Officer.

question: The Price Variation clause should stipulate a minimum percentage of variation of the contract price above which price variations will be admissible-True/False.
answer: True. If the percentage is fixed 5%, then any increase in price up-to 5% will not be paid.

question: No claim for the payment from contractor shall be entertained after the lapse of ____years of arising of the claim.
answer: Three (3)

question: A new autonomous body should not be created without the approval of the _____
answer: Cabinet

question: Regional Centres/Offices/Sub-Stations of any autonomous body can be created with prior approval of the ______
answer: administrative Ministry/Department in consultation with Ministry of Finance

question: A Corpus Fund out of budgetary allocation for an Autonomous Body only with prior concurrence of ______
answer: Ministry of Finance. If it is created out of internal resources approval of the administrative Ministry must be obtained.

question: _____ should review the user charges or internal source of income of an autonomous body at least _____year.
answer: Governing Body, once a year.

question: _______of the Autonomous body will be responsible for overall financial management of the autonomous bodies.
answer: The Chief Executive Officer

question: Peer review of autonomous organisations whether external or internal shall be made every___
answer: three or five years (depending upon the size of the organisation). Findings of the peer review should be examined and put up to the Secretary. Further releases of Grant (after three or five years, as the case may be), should be made conditional on conduct and decisions on the findings of such peer review.

question: Autonomous organisations are need to enter into a Memorandum of Understanding with the Administrative Ministry or Department where the budgetary support to autonomous organisation is ___
answer: more than Rupees five crores per annum (MoU spells out clearly performance parameters, output targets in terms of details of programme of work and qualitative improvement in output)

question: What is the Central Financial Assistance (CFA)?
answer: the expenditure has already been incurred on approved project/scheme and reimbursement from the Government in the form of Grant/Subsidy etc. No Utilization Certificate shall be required in such cases

question: Unspent Balances of recurring Grants-in-aid are ____
answer: taken into account in sanctioning the subsequent Grant for same purpose.

question: Before releasing any grant to an autonomous organisation, it should be ensured that Cash balance at a time should preferably not be more than ____ months of requirements
answer: Three (3). It is also known as Just-in Time Release.

question: Non-Government or Quasi-Government Institutions or Organisations cannot dispose of assets acquired wholly or substantially out of Government Grants without the approval of______
answer: (prior) authority which sanctioned the Grants-in-aid. Surplus/obsolete/unserviceable items may be disposed of by the Organisation in accordance with the provisions given in GFR

question: Institution or Organisation desiring Grants from Government shall submit their requirement with supporting details by the end of the month of ____ in the year preceding the year for which the Grants-in-aid is sought.
answer: September. The Institution or Organisation should be informed of the result of their requests by April of the succeeding year.

question: All Grantee Institutions or Organisations, which receive _____ percent their recurring expenditure in the form of Grants-in-aid, should formulate terms and conditions of service of their employees
answer: more than fifty (50% plus). Such conditions by and large, should not higher than those applicable to similar categories of employees in Central Government. In exceptional cases relaxation may be made in consultation with the Ministry of Finance.

question: Grants-in-aid may be sanctioned to meet the bonafide expenditure incurred not earlier than _____prior to the date of issue of the sanction.
answer: two years

question: Clause of providing reservation for SC, ST and OBC in posts by the Grantee organisation in cases where_____
answer: (i) the recipient body employs more than twenty (20) persons on a regular basis and at least fifty per cent (50%) of its recurring expenditure is met from Grants-in-aid from Central Government and (ii) the body is a registered society or a co-operative institution and is in receipt of a general purpose annual Grants-in-aid of Rupees twenty lakhs and above (₹ 25 lakh plus) from the Consolidated Fund of India

question: The Grants-in-aid should not exceed _____ percent of approved administrative expenditure on pay and allowances of the personnel of the voluntary organisation concerned.
answer: twenty-five (25%). Grants-in-aid to meet administrative expenditure to any private institutions other than the voluntary organizations should not ordinarily be sanctioned. In exceptional cases such Grants can be considered for sanction in consultation with Internal Finance Wing.

question: In case a voluntary organisation fails to comply the terms and conditions of Bond executed, the whole or a part amount of the Grant will liable to be refunded along with penal interest at the rate of______
answer: ten percent (10%) per annum. Or the sum specified under the Bond as the case may be.

question: _____will bear the cost of stamp duty for the Bond executed between the Government and Voluntary organisation before sanctioning the grant
answer: the Government.

question: To ensure monitoring and effective control over Centrally Sponsored Schemes, capacity building, inter-sectoral coordination and detailed monitoring rests with ______
answer: Central Ministries or Departments.

question: A post-completion review of every Centrally Sponsored Scheme should be undertaken by___
answer: the State Government(s) or Union Territories implementing the scheme. A copy of the review should be obtained by the Ministry concerned.

question: Institutions or Organisations receiving Grants should, irrespective of the amount involved, furnish a set of audited statement of accounts to _____
answer: the Accounts Officer

question: The accounts of the Grantee Institution or Organisation shall be audited by the CAG, if the Grants or loans to the institution in a financial year are not less than Rupees twenty five lakhs and also not less than seventy-five percent of the total expenditure of the Institution under the provision of___
answer: Section 14 of DPC Act, 1971. It is also audited by the CAG where the Grants or loan in a financial year are not less than one crore.

question: Where the accounts are required to be audited by the CAG in a financial year, he shall continue to audit the accounts for a further period of _____ years.
answer: Two (total 3 years in a row), in all cases notwithstanding that the conditions for the CAG’s audit are not fulfilled.

question: Where any Grant and /or loan is given for any specific purpose to any Institution or Organisation or Authority other Foreign body, the CAG is empowered to scrutinize the procedures by which the sanctioning authority satisfies itself as to the fulfilment of the conditions subject to which such Grants and/or loans were given under the provision of_____
answer: Section 15 of the DPC Act, 1971. For this purpose, the CAG has the right of access to the books and accounts of that Institute or Organisation or authority.

question: _____will report all cases of outstanding guarantees at the end of a calendar year, to Budget Division, along with all payments made in pursuance of the guarantee.
answer: Financial Adviser of the concerned Ministry/Department

question: Where a Guarantee Reserve Fund does not exist, the irrecoverable amount of loan shall be adjusted under the minor head "Irrecoverable Loans Written Off", below the major/sub-major head______
answer: to the purpose/function for which the loans etc. had been granted. Where the purpose or function is unidentifiable it will be debited to Major Head 2075- Misc. General Services

question: The Finance Wing of Ministry/Department furnishes data required for the Statement of Finance Account pertaining to Guarantee to Pr. CCA/CCA/CA by ______
answer: 21st April. The CCA/CA in turn would furnish the same to the Finance Accounts Section of the office of CGA latest by 31st May each year.

question: In order to meet the contingent liability arising out of guarantees invoked by Public Sector Banks every year, an amount as decided each year is provided under the head 'Transfer to Guarantee Redemption Fund' below the Major Head  ______ in the Demand for Grant of Ministry of Finance, Department ______.
answer: '2075-Misc. General Services, Department of Economic Affairs.

question: Sanctions for permanent advance accorded by ______
answer: Heads of Department

question: Acknowledgement from the officers holding permanent advance shall be obtained as on _____ in the month of _____.
answer: 31st March, April

question: Normally no loan should be granted for a period exceeding 15 years. Where a longer period for repayment is sought, prior concurrence of the _____ will be necessary
answer: Budget Division, Ministry of Finance. In no case, however, the period of the loan should exceed 30 years.

question: The repayment on a loan should commence from the _____
answer: first anniversary date of its drawal or on expiry of the period of moratorium, as the case may be. The recovery should ordinarily be effected in annual equal instalments of principal.

question: In the case of loan given to public sector projects for new installations or expansion of existing institutions, the repayment of principal should ordinarily commence___
answer: one year after the project commences production. In other cases, a moratorium (suspension) subject to a maximum of five years from the date of drawal of the loans may be allowed. However, this period should not exceed two years from the date of project going into production, or expanded project coming into operation.

question: The period of repayment of working capital loans should preferably be restricted to ___ years. In no case, however, the period of these loans should exceed _____years.
answer: two or three, five (5).

question: Approved and authenticated annual accounts to be made available by the Autonomous Body to the concerned Audit Office by____
answer: 30th June. It is the date on which audit of annual accounts commences. Issue of the final SAR in English version with audit certificate to Autonomous Body/ Government concerned -31st October and submission Annual Report and Audited Accounts to Nodal agency by 31st Dec.

question: Utilisation Certificate in respect of non-recurring grants shall be submitted by the grantee institution with in____
answer: Twelve (12) after closure of the Financial Year. Rule 238 (1) deals with Utilisation Certificate, failing of which the institution may be black-listed.

question: Release of Grants-in-aid in excess of ______% of the total amount sanctioned for the subsequent financial year shall be done only after utilisation certificate and the annual audited statement relating to Grants-in-aid released in the preceding year are submitted to the satisfaction of the Ministry/Department concerned.
answer: Seventy-five percent (75%)

question: Where the Grants –in –aid / Central Finance Assistance are being made as reimbursement of expenditure already incurred on the basis of duly audited accounts, Utilisation Certificate need not be obtained-True/False
answer: True. In such cases the sanction letters should specify clearly that the Utilization Certificates will not be necessary.

question: In the case of Private and Voluntary Organizations receiving recurring Grants-in-aid for amount ________ all the Ministries or Departments of Government of India should include in their Annual Report a statement showing the quantum of funds provided to each of those organizations and the purpose for which they were utilized, for the information of Parliament.
answer: Rupees ten lakhs to less than Rupees fifty lakhs (₹ 10 lakh to ₹ 50 lakh). In case amount exceeds ₹ 50 lakh, the Annual Reports and accounts shall be laid before Parliament within 9 months (December) of close of succeeding financial year i.e. 21 months from close of financial year in which grant was released. The same applies to non-recurring or one time grants.

question: Utilisation Certificate required to be submitted by the State Government against Central Grant  should be counter-signed by ____
answer: the Administrative Secretary of the Division regulating the Scheme/Finance Secretary

question: When Central Grants are given to State Governments for expenditure to be incurred by them through local bodies or private institutions, the Utilization Certificates should be furnished by ____
answer: the State Government concerned.

question: The Grantee Institutions or Organisations should be required to submit performance cum achievement reports soon after the end of the financial year, and in any case, not later than_____
answer: six months after the close of the financial year (September of following year). In regard to non-recurring Grants such as for celebration of anniversaries, conduct of special tours and maintenance Grants for education, performance cum-achievement reports need not be obtained.

question: The sanctioning authority may dispense with the submission of performance cum achievement reports where the grantee receives the recurring grant-in-aid not exceeding Rs_____
answer: Twenty-five (25 lakh). Where the audited report and account incorporated in Ministry/Department Report or laid before parliament, Performance cum achievement certificate need not required.

question: A Register of Grants shall be maintained by _____ in the format given in Form GFR - 21.
answer: the sanctioning authority

question: Grants-in-aid for provision of amenities or of recreational or welfare facilities to the staff of the offices of the Government are regulated under orders of ______
answer: the Ministry of Home Affairs.

question: The Grant in aid towards amenities or of recreational or welfare facilities to the staff will be admissible on the basis of the total strength borne on _______ (Regular/contingency/WCE/all) of an organization
answer: borne on the regular strength. The total strength of the eligible staff will be that existing on the thirty-first (31st) March of the previous financial year or that on the date on which proposal for Grant is mooted in the case of new staff clubs.

question: The rate of the Grant-in-aid towards amenities or of recreational or welfare facilities to the eligible staff will be Rupees _______.
answer: fifty (₹ 50) per head per annum. Additional grant-in-aid up to ₹ 25/- per head per annum to match the subscriptions collected during the previous financial year by the existing staff clubs or for the new clubs till date of proposal mooted. Maximum per head grant-in-aid would be ₹ 75/- per annum.

question: For setting up of recreational club, one time Grant to the tune of maximum of Rupees____ may be sanctioned.
answer: ₹ 50 thousand.

question: The accounts of recreational clubs duly audited by an Internal Auditor should be obtained on or before______
answer: Thirtieth (30th ) April.

question: Nodal agency to finalise terms and conditions of loans by the Central Government is___
answer: Ministry of Finance (Department of Economic Affairs> Budget Division)

question: The interest for the full period shall be charged, if the payment of the instalment is in advance of the due date by ________
answer: fourteen (14) days or less. If it is paid in advance by more the 14 days, then interest will be calculated for number of days i.e. Yearly interest/365 or 366 days X No. of days.

question: When the due date of repayment of any instalment of principal or interest falls on a Sunday or a public holiday, the payment made on _____will be regarded as payment made on due date.
answer: the next working day following the Sunday or the public holiday. However, in case where due date is 31st March, the preceding day will be regarded as due date.

question: When monetary settlement is involved in loan given by the Central Govt. to State Govt., the date of drawl of loan by the State Govt. is _________
answer: the calendar date on which amount of a loan is actually credited to the account of the State Government by the Reserve Bank. Except in case of March where the loan accounted in Central Govt’.s account in March but credit afforded by RBI to State Govt. in April. .

question: Where no monetary settlement is involved in loan from Central Govt. to State Govt., the date of drawl will be ________
answer: the last date of the month of account in which the adjustment is effected

question: Before considering a loan application from parties other than State Governments and Union Territories, copies of PL/income and expenditure accounts and balance sheets for last _____years should be obtained.
answer: three (3). Required even when a guarantee is given by Trust managing the grantee institution.

question: A loan should bear the interest for the period ______
answer: day of payment inclusive but date of repayment exclusive.

question: The repayment of principal and interest instalments may be rounded off to the nearest ____
answer: rupee (repayment in equal annual instalment)

question: Loans to State and Union Territory Governments, Local Bodies, Statutory Corporations, PSUs etc. shall be sanctioned at the ____ rates of interest prescribed by Government
answer: normal. where the normal rate is considered too high and a concession is justified, it shall take the form of direct subsidy debitable to the grants of the sanctioning authority. In such cases interest shall, however, be paid by the borrower in the first instance at the normal rates and subsidy shall be claimed separately.

question: A written undertaking in Form GFR 15 shall be obtained from _____ at the time of sanctioning the loan.
answer: a wholly Government-owned company (No need to enter into an agreement in case of loan to State Govt. and a wholly Government-owned company), a written undertaking to the effect that the fixed assets of the company shall not be hypothecated without prior approval of the Government shall be obtained in Form GFR 32.

question: Loans to parties other than State Govt., wholly owned Govt Companies and Local Administration of UTs shall be sanctioned only against adequate security which should be at least ______
answer: thirty-three and one-third per cent more than the amount of the loan (133.33%)

question: Utilisation Certification in respect of loan and grants-in-aid made to parties other than State Governments, wholly owned Government Companies and Local Administration of UTs shall be submitted within______
answer: 18 months from close of the financial year in which loan or grant-in-aid was sanctioned.

question: In case of default in repayment of principal and interest, the penal or the higher rate of interest, should not be less than ______ above the normal rate of interest prescribed by Government.
answer: two and half per cent (2.5%) per annum

question: Any loans owing to their irrecoverability or otherwise may be written off by________
answer: competent authority with prior approval of Ministry of Finance

question: Annual Report on outstanding Central Loans borne on a Ministry/Department’s books as on 31st March each year shall be submitted by the Pr. AO to concerned Ministry/Department by____
answer: 30th September.

question: A copy of Annual Assessment Report on status of all outstanding loans, including timely and accurate payment of principal and interest due, shall be submitted by the Financial Advisor of the Administrative Ministry concerned to the Ministry of Finance by_____.
answer: 30th June of each financial year

question: ____ acts as the nodal agency to execute the legal agreement for loans or grants from external funding Agency(ies).
answer: Department of Economic Affairs (MoF). The Office of the Controller of Aid Accounts and Audit (CAAA) in the Department of Economic Affairs

question: Under the Revolving Fund Scheme, the Funding Agency disburses the estimated expenditure of _______for the projects as initial advance to Government of India under the respective loan or credit or grant agreement.
answer: four months

question: Powers to grant Government of India Guarantee, including those on external borrowings, vests with the ______ Division, Department of Economic Affairs (DEA).
answer: Budget. Guarantee provision is given in Article 292 and FRBM Act.

question: The maximum percentage of project loan to which the Government may guarantee is ____
answer: 80%. the Government of India may guarantee 100% of the financing where the organisation concerned is discharging some function on behalf of the Government of India.

question: ________ in Ministry/Department will perform the responsibility of maintenance of records and reporting to concerned authorities (CAAA)
answer: The Financial Advisers

question: All Ministries or Departments shall ensure that all guarantees are reviewed at-least once in____
answer: a year (every year). Such review is made by the FA and a report of it is submitted to Budget Division (MoF) by 30th April of following year.

question: In respect of guarantees issued by the Ministry of Finance for external loans, the respective credit divisions of Department of Economic Affairs shall conduct an annual review in consultation with the Financial Adviser, DEA-True/False.
answer: True.

question: For the purpose of record keeping, guarantees shall be classified into____ categories
answer: Six (6)

question: Indian Government Accounting Standard (IGAS) deals with Government Guarantees is ____
answer: IGAS-1

question: A Guarantee Redemption Fund (GRF) has been established in_____ (Consolidated/Contingency/Public Account/PD Account)
answer: Public Account (Major Head 8235-Minor Head 117, Minor Head 120-GRF-Investment Account)

question: All proposals for Provision and instructions relating to additions to establishment are given in____
answer: DFPR (Rule 11)

question: The valid birth certificate in cases where the prescribed educational qualification of a Govt. Servant is below the matriculation are_____
answer: Municipal Birth Certificate or Certificate from the recognised school last attended. Matriculation certificate will be valid certificate for date of birth where prescribed educational qualification is matric or above

question: Detailed Rules for maintenance of Service Books are contained in _____
answer: Supplementary Rules.

question: In ______ each year the Government servant shall handover his copy of the Service Book to his office for updation.
answer: January. The service after having duly updated in returned to the employee with 30 days. The Service Book is maintained in duplicate. Original by office and duplicate by employee concerned.

question: In case the Government servants’ copy is lost by the government servant, it shall be replaced on payment of a sum of ______
The travelling allowance claim shall be submitted within ______ of its becoming due failing which it shall stand forfeited.
answer: sixty (60) days. In case of LTC-30 days (advance case) and 60 days (Non-advance case)

question: A claim for overtime allowance shall fall due for payment on _____
answer: first day of the month following the month to which the overtime allowance relates. The claim shall be submitted within sixty (60) days from becoming due.

question: An increment may be withheld under the provision of _____
answer: FR 24.

question: Any arrear claim of a Government servant which is preferred within ______ of its becoming due shall be settled by the Drawing and Disbursing Officer or Accounts Officer, as the case may be, after usual checks.
answer: two (2) years. Exceeding that after due investigation by the HoD.

question: A sanction to an advance or a non-refundable part withdrawal from Provident Fund shall, unless it is specifically renewed, lapse on the expiry of a period of ________
answer: three (3) months

question: Compensation for accidental loss of property shall be paid to an officer with the approval of __
answer: the Ministry of Finance.

question: Transfer of land from a UT to a Central Government Department or vice versa shall be on__
answer: 'no profit no loss' basis. Transfer of buildings and superstructures on land vide above shall be at the present day cost minus depreciation. In respect of PSU such transfer on market value.

question: Any amount or loan not paid on due date to Government by a local body, may be adjusted from___ (any non-statutory grant/statutory grant) sanctioned for payment to it.
answer: non-statutory grant.

question: Financial transactions between Govt. and local bodies shall be rounded off to the nearest ____
answer: Rupee.

question: The adjustment bill along with balance if any towards advances drawn for contingent and misc. purposes shall be submitted by the government servant within _____ of the drawal of advance
answer: fifteen (15) days

question: The Ministry or Department may sanction the grant of an advance to a Government Pleader in connection with law suits up to the maximum of _____ at a time
answer: Rupees twenty-five thousand (₹ 25000)
